intro: Senecio melanocephalus, commonly known as the black-headed groundsel, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It features a woody stem with dark green, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, which are surrounded by a distinctive blackish-purple involucrum. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in some regions as a garden plant.
